com.smartnsoft.droid4me.ws
Class WebServiceCaller

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.ws.WebServiceCaller
All Implemented Interfaces:
WebServiceClient
public abstract class WebServiceCaller
extends java.lang.Object
implements WebServiceClient

A basis class for making web service calls easier.

When invoking an HTTP method, the caller goes through the following workflow:

  1. the isConnected() method is checked: if the return value is set to false, no request will be attempted and a WebServiceCaller.CallException exception will be thrown (embedding a UnknownHostException exception) ;
  2. the #onBeforeHttpRequestExecution(DefaultHttpClient, HttpRequestBase) method will be invoked, so as to let the caller tune the HTTP method request ;
  3. if a connection issue arises (connection time-out, socket time-out, lost of connectivity), a WebServiceCaller.CallException exception will be thrown, and it will embed the reason for the connection issue ;
  4. if the status code of the HTTP response does not belong to the [HttpStatus.SC_OK, HttpStatus.SC_MULTI_STATUS] range, the onStatusCodeNotOk(String, WebServiceClient.CallType, HttpEntity, HttpResponse, int, int) method will be invoked.

Since:
2009.03.26
Author:
Édouard Mercier

static interface WebServiceCaller.ReuseHttpClient
          An empty interface which states that the underlying HttpClient instance should be reused for all HTTP requests, instead of creating a new one each time.

getInputStream

public final java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String uri,
                                                WebServiceClient.CallType callType,
                                                org.apache.http.HttpEntity body)
                                         throws WebServiceClient.CallException
Performs an HTTP request corresponding to the provided parameters.

Specified by:
getInputStream in interface WebServiceClient
Parameters:
uri - the URI being requested
callType - the HTTP method
body - if the HTTP method is set to WebServiceCaller.CallType#Post or WebServiceCaller.CallType#Put, this is the body of the request
Returns:
the input stream of the HTTP method call; cannot be null
Throws:
WebServiceCaller.CallException - if the status code of the HTTP response does not belong to the [HttpStatus.SC_OK, HttpStatus.SC_MULTI_STATUS] range. Also if a connection issue occurred: the exception will embed the cause of the exception. If the isConnected() method returns false, no request will be attempted and a WebServiceCaller.CallException exception will be thrown (embedding a UnknownHostException exception).
WebServiceClient.CallException - in case an error occurred during the HTTP request execution

onStatusCodeNotOk

protected boolean onStatusCodeNotOk(java.lang.String uri,
                                    WebServiceClient.CallType callType,
                                    org.apache.http.HttpEntity body,
                                    org.apache.http.HttpResponse response,
                                    int statusCode,
                                    int attemptsCount)
                             throws WebServiceClient.CallException
Invoked when the result of the HTTP request is not 20X. The default implementation logs the problem and throws an exception.

Parameters:
uri - the URI of the HTTP call
callType - the type of the HTTP method
body - the body of the HTTP method when its a WebServiceCaller.CallType#Post or a WebServiceCaller.CallType#Put ; null otherwise
response - the HTTP response
statusCode - the status code of the response, which is not 20X
attemptsCount - the number of attempts that have been run for this HTTP method. Starts at 1
Returns:
true if you want the request to be re-run if it has failed
Throws:
WebServiceCaller.CallException - if you want the call to be considered as not OK
WebServiceClient.CallException

onBeforeHttpRequestExecution

protected void onBeforeHttpRequestExecution(org.apache.http.client.HttpClient httpClient,
                                            org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpRequestBase request)
                                     throws WebServiceClient.CallException
This is the perfect place for customizing the HTTP request that is bound to be run.

Parameters:
httpClient - the Apache HTTP client that will run the HTTP request
request - the HTTP request
Throws:
WebServiceCaller.CallException - in case the HTTP request cannot be eventually invoked properly
WebServiceClient.CallException

getContent

protected java.io.InputStream getContent(java.lang.String uri,
                                         WebServiceClient.CallType callType,
                                         org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Invoked on every call, in order to extract the input stream from the response.

If the content type is gzipped, this is the ideal place for unzipping it.

Parameters:
uri - the web call initial URI
callType - the kind of request
response - the HTTP response
Returns:
the (decoded) input stream of the response
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if some exception occurred while extracting the content of the response

computeUri

public final java.lang.String computeUri(java.lang.String methodUriPrefix,
                                         java.lang.String methodUriSuffix,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> uriParameters)
Description copied from interface: WebServiceClient
Is responsible for converting the given URI parameters into a stringified URI.

Specified by:
computeUri in interface WebServiceClient
Parameters:
methodUriPrefix - the prefix of the URI
methodUriSuffix - the suffix of the URI, not containing the query parameters. A / will split the methodUriPrefix and methodUriSuffix parameters in the final URI
uriParameters - a map of key/values that will be used as query parameters in the final URI
Returns:
a properly encoded URI

encodeUri

public static java.lang.String encodeUri(java.lang.String methodUriPrefix,
                                         java.lang.String methodUriSuffix,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> uriParameters,
                                         java.lang.String urlEnconding)
Computes a URI from its path elements.

Parameters:
methodUriPrefix - the URI prefix
methodUriSuffix - the URI suffix ; a / separator will be appended after the methodUriPrefix parameter. May be null
uriParameters - a dictionary with String keys and String values, which holds the URI parameters ; may be null. If a value is null, an error log will be issued
urlEnconding - the encoding used for writing the URI parameters values
Returns:

getHttpClient

protected final org.apache.http.client.HttpClient getHttpClient()
Is responsible for returning an HTTP client instance, used for actually running the HTTP request.

The current implementation returns a WebServiceCaller.SensibleHttpClient instance, which is thread-safe, in case the extending class implements the WebServiceCaller.ReuseHttpClient interface.

Returns:
a valid HTTP client
See Also:
computeHttpClient()

computeHttpClient

protected org.apache.http.client.HttpClient computeHttpClient()
This method will be invoked by the getHttpClient() method, when it needs to use a new WebServiceCaller.ReuseHttpClient. The method should be overridden, when the WebServiceCaller.ReuseHttpClient to use should be customized; a typical case is when the connection time-outs, the HTTP User-Agent parameters need to fine-tuned.

In the case the class implements WebServiceCaller.ReuseHttpClient interface, this method will be invoked only once.

Returns:
an HTTP client that will be used for running HTTP requests
